item.title: 卡尼在渥太华开始工作，大选鼓声日益响亮
item.description: 马克-卡尼（Mark Carney）开始为迅速接任加拿大总理一职打下基础，在自由党成员推选他为新领导人后，立法者和内阁部长们周一举行了重要会议。【原文：Mark Carney began laying the groundwork to take over quickly as Canada’s prime minister, with lawmakers and cabinet ministers holding key meetings Monday after Liberal Party members chose him as their new leader.】

item.title: 迈克尔-珀尔夫斯谈如何进行欧洲大宗商品交易
item.description: 大家好，欢迎收看《奇货可居》时事通讯，这里每天都有来自《奇货可居》的精彩内容。有时是我们乔-韦森塔尔（Joe Weisenthal）和特蕾西-阿洛维（Tracy Alloway）为您带来我们对市场、金融和经济最新发展的看法。有时是我们的专家嘉宾和消息来源网络提供的内容。不管是什么，我们保证永远有趣。【原文：Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.】

item.title: Blackstone 私人信贷间隔基金获美国证券交易委员会批准
item.description: 美国证券交易委员会周一批准了 Blackstone Inc. 最新的私人信贷基金，该基金旨在为散户投资者提供私人持有资产的投资机会，其流动性高于许多同类基金。【原文：The US Securities and Exchange Commission on Monday approved Blackstone Inc.’s newest private credit fund, which aims to give retail investors exposure to privately held assets with more liquidity than many comparable vehicles.】

item.title: 特朗普的贸易威胁开始冲击加拿大信贷市场
item.description: 唐纳德-特朗普（Donald Trump）和贾斯汀-特鲁多（Justin Trudeau）之间的关税对峙使加拿大公司债券的销售在过去一周里放缓至涓涓细流，因为投资者要求更高的溢价来持有卢比债券。【原文：The tariff throwdown between Donald Trump and Justin Trudeau has slowed Canadian corporate bond sales to a trickle over the past week as investors demand a higher premium to hold loonie debt.】

item.title: 安大略省将明尼苏达州、密歇根州和纽约州的电价提高 25
item.description: 加拿大一个向美国出口电力的省份周一将三个州的电价提高了 25%，以报复唐纳德-特朗普总统的关税。【原文：A Canadian province that exports electricity to the US raised power prices for three states by 25% on Monday in retaliation for President Donald Trump’s tariffs.】

item.title: 英国统计局挑战交易商，维持早上 7 点的发布时间
item.description: 英国的关键经济数据将继续在上午 7 点发布，这对希望统计局恢复到疫情爆发前上午 9 点 30 分常态的交易员和投资者来说是一个打击。【原文：Key UK economic data will continue to be released at 7 a.m., a blow to traders and investors who wanted the statistics office to revert to the pre-pandemic norm of 9.30 a.m.】

item.title: 经济衰退警钟长鸣，股市上涨势头迅猛
item.description: 两年来，美国股市几乎直线上升。短短几周内，这种情况就发生了翻天覆地的变化，随着股市下挫的加剧，华尔街正在思考它的终点在哪里。【原文：For two years, US stocks went virtually straight up. In a matter of weeks, that’s been turned upside down, and as the equities selloff intensifies Wall Street is wondering where it stops.】

item.title: 美国消费者悲观情绪加重，长期通胀前景稳定
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行的一项月度调查显示，美国消费者预计近期通胀率将略有上升，并且对自己的财务状况越来越悲观。【原文：US consumers expect slightly higher inflation in the near term and are growing more pessimistic about their finances, according to a monthly survey from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.】

item.title: 纳斯达克 100 指数暴跌 3%，大科技股跌势未见减缓迹象
item.description: 科技大盘股的溃败丝毫没有减弱的迹象。【原文：A rout in technology megacaps is showing no signs of letting up.】

item.title: 据说巴斯夫将利用德意志银行和高盛集团为农化产品上市做准备
item.description: 巴斯夫公司（BASF SE）已选择银行帮助安排其农用化学品部门的潜在上市，熟悉此事的人士称，这家德国制造商正在推进其更广泛的改革。【原文：BASF SE has selected banks to help arrange the potential listing of its agricultural chemicals division, people familiar with the matter said, as the German manufacturer forges ahead with its broader revamp.】

item.title: 马斯克的 X 汽车在全球遭遇间歇性故障
item.description: 社交媒体平台 X 出现了间歇性故障，全球各地的用户都表示无法访问该服务。【原文：Social media platform X experienced intermittent outages, with users across the globe saying they could not access the service.】

item.title: 奈拉在数月保持稳定后被油价打乱了阵脚
item.description: 尼日利亚奈拉兑美元汇率下滑，此前油价走软和当地货币市场利率走低破坏了奈拉近期的稳定。【原文：Nigeria’s naira slipped against the dollar after softer oil prices and lower local money market rates disrupted its recent stability.】

item.title: 俄罗斯银行称地缘政治希望提振当地市场
item.description: 据俄罗斯央行称，对地缘政治紧张局势缓和的预期增强，推动了俄罗斯金融市场上个月的上涨，卢布也取得了 "显著 "涨幅。【原文：Increased expectations of a drop in geopolitical tension fueled gains for Russia’s financial markets last month, with the ruble notching up “significant” gains, according to the central bank.】

item.title: 欧洲央行行长纳格尔称降息并非自动驾驶
item.description: 欧洲中央银行理事会约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，欧洲中央银行不会自动降息，他拒绝预测下月政策会议的结果。【原文：The European Central Bank isn’t lowering interest rates on autopilot, according to Governing Council Joachim Nagel, who declined to predict the outcome of next month’s policy meeting.】

item.title: 美国餐馆在科维德外卖热潮之后生产率跃升
item.description: 根据芝加哥联邦储备银行行长奥斯坦-古尔斯比（Austan Goolsbee）共同撰写的一份新研究报告，外卖订单的转变帮助美国餐馆的生产率在大流行后激增了 15%，而在此之前的一代人中，美国餐馆的生产率基本保持不变。【原文：A shift to take-out orders helped US restaurants enjoy a 15% post-pandemic surge in productivity, which had remained largely unchanged for a generation before that, according to a new study co-written by Austan Goolsbee, president of the Federal Reserve Bank of Chicago.】

item.title: 凯雷的杰夫-库里说，世界已达到 "石油贸易峰值
item.description: 凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc）的杰夫-库里（Jeff Currie）周一在一份研究报告中写道，化石燃料跨境贸易在2017年达到顶峰，随着寻求能源安全的国家加快对可再生能源和核能的投资，化石燃料跨境贸易必将下降。【原文：The trade in fossil fuels across borders peaked in 2017 and is set to decline as nations seeking energy security accelerate investments in renewable and nuclear power, Carlyle Group Inc.’s Jeff Currie wrote in a research note Monday.】

item.title: 阿尔伯塔省的史密斯认为石油产量不会因关税而放缓
item.description: S&P 全球能源会议（CERAWeek by S&P Global energy conference）的首批头条新闻之一，让我们窥见了 2025 年可能出现的最大主题：关税。【原文：One of the very first headlines from the CERAWeek by S&P Global energy conference offers a sneak peek into what is likely the biggest theme coming into 2025: tariffs.】

item.title: 热带气旋 "裘德 "穿过莫桑比克北部靠近煤炭枢纽的地区
item.description: 热带气旋 "裘德 "于周一凌晨在莫桑比克东北海岸登陆，在该国主要煤炭出口码头附近带来了破坏性狂风和暴雨。【原文：Tropical Cyclone Jude made landfall on Mozambique’s northeastern coast in the early hours of Monday, bringing damaging winds and torrential rain near the nation’s main coal export terminal.】

item.title: 最高法院驳回 BMC 案，IBM 无需支付 16 亿美元赔偿金
item.description: KKR & Co. 的 BMC 软件公司指控国际商用机器公司违反许可协议挖走一名客户，美国最高法院拒绝恢复对国际商用机器公司 16 亿美元的裁决。【原文：The US Supreme Court refused to revive a $1.6 billion award against International Business Machines Corp., which was accused by KKR & Co.’s BMC Software of poaching a client in violation of a licensing agreement.】

item.title: 瑞典军事装备出口跃升至历史新高
item.description: 由于俄罗斯入侵乌克兰继续加剧全球安全担忧，瑞典去年的军事装备出口额达到 290 亿克朗（29 亿美元），创历史最高水平。【原文：Sweden’s exports of military equipment reached the highest level on record last year at 29 billion kronor ($2.9 billion) as Russia’s invasion of Ukraine continued to fuel global security fears.】

item.title: 在关税和建国威胁下，加拿大赴美旅游人数骤减
item.description: 在唐纳德-特朗普总统对加拿大的主权和经济发出威胁之际，加拿大人似乎正在放弃前往美国的公路旅行。【原文：Canadians appeared to be abandoning road trips to the US amid President Donald Trump’s sovereignty and economic threats to their country.】

item.title: 欧洲银行财报中，"ESG "输给了 "人工智能"。
item.description: 人工智能已取代可持续发展，成为欧洲银行的最新流行语。【原文：Artificial intelligence has replaced sustainability as the latest buzzword for European banks.】

item.title: 纳格尔说：德国需要改革，也需要增加开支
item.description: 德国联邦银行行长约阿希姆-纳格尔（Joachim Nagel）表示，德国经济需要改革来提高增长潜力和竞争力，不能仅仅依靠增加支出来摆脱多年的停滞状态。【原文：Germany’s economy needs reforms to improve growth potential and competitiveness, and mustn’t rely solely on higher spending to rescue it from years of stagnation, Bundesbank President Joachim Nagel said.】

item.title: 印度斯坦锌业公司时隔四年重返卢比债券市场
item.description: 印度斯坦锌业有限公司（Hindustan Zinc Ltd.）董事会周一批准了一项通过债券融资多达 50 亿卢比（约合 5730 万美元）的提案，这将是这家由富豪阿尼尔-阿加瓦尔（Anil Agarwal）领导的公司至少四年来首次发行本币债券。【原文：Hindustan Zinc Ltd.’s board on Monday cleared a proposal to raise as much as 5 billion rupees ($57.3 million) through a bond, which will be the tycoon Anil Agarwal-led firm’s first local-currency issuance in at least four years.】

item.title: 软银支持的自动驾驶公司 Wayve 接近商业亮相
item.description: Wayve Technologies Ltd. 是一家自动驾驶初创公司，去年从包括软银集团在内的投资者那里筹集了超过 10 亿美元的资金。【原文：Wayve Technologies Ltd., the self-driving startup that raised more than $1 billion last year from investors including SoftBank Group Corp., said it’s nearing a commercial debut with major automakers.】

item.title: 关税、裁员引发衰退担忧，美国信贷风险上升
item.description: 周一上午，美国的信贷风险指数达到了今年以来的最高水平，因为在关税和联邦政府裁员的影响下，投资者对美国的经济状况表现出了新的担忧。【原文：US gauges are showing their highest levels of credit risk this year Monday morning, as investors exhibit fresh concern about the state of the country’s economy in light of tariffs and cuts to the federal workforce.】

item.title: 总统黄油制造商称关税将推高消费者价格
item.description: 总统黄油生产商表示，对美国进口农产品征收关税将提高消费者的消费价格，因为企业会转嫁额外成本。【原文：The maker of Président butter said tariffs on agriculture imports into the US will raise prices for consumers as companies pass on additional costs.】

item.title: 赛勒出售高达 210 亿美元优先股的战略
item.description: Michael Saylor's Strategy 表示，公司计划发行高达 210 亿美元的优先股，并将所得资金用于购买更多比特币和其他一般企业用途。【原文：Michael Saylor’s Strategy said it plans to issue up to $21 billion of preferred stock and use the proceeds to buy more Bitcoin and for other general corporate purposes.】

item.title: 西非天气改善，交易清淡，可可价格下跌
item.description: 由于天气好转和投机性赌注减少，可可价格下跌，进一步偏离了去年创纪录的涨势。【原文：Cocoa fell as improving weather and reduced speculative wagers push prices further away from last year’s record-breaking rally.】

item.title: 默茨为何面临放宽德国财政规则的艰难之路
item.description: 德国计划修改宪法，以取消为国防举债的限制，并建立一个 5000 亿欧元（5410 亿美元）的基础设施基金。【原文：Germany plans to amend its constitution in order to remove limits on raising debt for defense and set up a €500 billion ($541 billion) infrastructure fund.】
